comments:
Not sure if this is related (or if it's a duplicate) or 54292/54198, but 
opening a new bugzilla just in case...

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
1. Start Eclipse from a new workspace.
2. File -> Import -> Log File
3. Add the access.log and error.log files from the examples (the Apache Http 
server logs) to the default log set. Click Finish to import these log files.
4. Click on the "Link with Viewer" toolbar button.
5. Right click on the error.log entry in the Log Navigator view -> Open With -> 
Log Thread Interractions. Click OK in the Correlation Schema pop-up.
6. Position your mouse over the access.log entry in the Log Navigator view, and 
right click on it.

At this point, an error pop-up appears. It looks (more or less) like this...

-------------------------------------------------------
Error
An error has occurred. See error log for more details.
-------------------------------------------------------

In the .log file, you will find...

!SESSION Mar 10, 2004 12:49:33.125 ---------------------------------------------

jitc)
